captions.text:
The godfather is sick,
right?

You're getting chased
from new york
by the other families.

You think you can come
to my hotel and take over?

I talked to barzini.
I can deal with him
and keep my hotel.

Is that why you slap
my brother in public?

Oh, now,
that was nothing, mike.

Now, moe didn't
mean nothing by that.

Sure, he flies
off the handle,

But moe and me,
we're good friends,
right?

I got a business to run.
I kick asses sometimes.
We had a little argument.

I had to
straighten him out.

You straightened
my brother out?

He was banging
cocktail waitresses
two at a time.

Players couldn't get
a drink at the table.

I leave for new york
tomorrow.
Think about a price.
Son of a bitch!

Do you know who I am?
I'm moe greene.

I made my bones when
you were dating cheerleaders.

Moe,
I got an idea.

Tom. Tom, you're
the <i>consigliori.</i>
Talk to the don--
Just a minute.

The don
is semiretired.

Mike is
in charge now.

If you have
anything to say,
say it to michael.

Mike, you don't
come to las vegas

And talk to a man like
moe greene like that!
Fredo...
You're my older brother,
And I love you,

But don't ever take sides
with anyone

Against the family
again.
Ever.

I have to see
my father
and his people.
Have dinner without me.
Oh, michael.
This weekend we'll go out.

We'll go to the city,
see a show, have dinner.

Your sister wants
to ask you something.
Let her ask.

title: Don't Ever Take Sides Against the Family - The Godfather (7/9) Movie CLIP (1972) HD

comments.author: Cwmbran1984

comments.text:
+Essie G. Moe isn't scared, he's described as a hothead and he acts 
accordingly. When Moe hears the "you straightened my brother out?" line, he 
looks at Michael incredulously and says "HE WAS BANGING COCKTAIL WAITRESSES 
TWO AT A TIME!! Players couldn't get a drink at the table, what's wrong 
with you??!!", in other words, he can't believe that Michael can't fathom 
what a complete worthless dumbshit Fredo really is, and he also looks at 
Michael as beneath him ("I made my bones when you were going out with 
cheerleaders.")  Moe Greene is modeled on Bugsy Siegel, considered the 
founder of Las Vegas.  In this scene, Moe Greene isn't afraid, he's 
*underestimating* Michael, and he's pissed that Michael is so cool and calm 
when in Moe's opinion, Michael should be giving him more respect than to 
offer to buy him out (in the scene before this Moe says to Michael "You buy 
me out?? No, I buy YOU out!!").
comments.author: Abominogg R

comments.text:

quietly and smokes his cigarette.

comments.author: Pack man

comments.text:
LEAVE THE MOVIE ALONE.

 What the heck is wrong with you people and your mindless reflex to remake 
everything? 

If modern Hollywood was worthy to remake this movie it wouldn't need to, 
because it would still  have the creativity to produce original material.
comments.author: periechontology

comments.text:
+gary wagner
Well, if  Bob Hoskins was still alive I would cast him as Frank Pentangeli, 
Alan Arkin as Hyman Roth, Danny Devito as Clemenza, James Franco as Moe 
Greene, Lou Feringno as Luca Brasi, and Paul-Ben Victor as Sollozzo.
comments.author: Pack man

comments.text:
+gary wagner
So you like my cast choice? And how would you feel about a Godfather remake 
where the storylines of the first two movies are formed into one story? 
With Vito Corleone reflecting on his past as a orphan immigrant from Sicily 
growing up on the streets of early 20th century New York City and turning 
from petty thief to the leader of a local street gang and eventually 
becoming a notorious and powerful mafia crime-boss while his youngest son 
Michael Corleone slowly falling down the same dark path as his father did 
and eventually taking his father's place as The Don. I think that could 
work, with the right screenwriter and director! What do you think?
comments.author: Corey Pack

comments.text:
What about a Godfather remake that combines the plot of both the original 
and the second Godfather into one movie with older Vito Corleone reflecting 
on his earlier years when he was an orphan boy from Sicily to him growing 
up to become a mafia kingpin and show Vito noticing how his youngest son 
Michael slowly losing his soul and becoming the man his father is but as 
Michael starts to lose his soul, his father Vito starts to find his soul. I 
think that would be a good way to go about a Godfather reboot! They could 
just forget about the third film and focus on the first two films and make 
them into one movie!﻿

comments.text:
Notice this clip shows the Hollywood continuum of Jews playing Italians and 
Italians playing Jews: Alex Rocco as Moe Green (based on real-life Jewish 
gangster Bugsy Siegel); James Caan and Abe Vigoda are Jewish. In GOODFELLAS 
Loraine Bracco played Henry Hill's Jewish wife; Joe Montagna has played 
Jewish characters in LIBERTY HEIGHTS and HOMICIDE (the movie, not the TV 
show!). This is NOT a "statement" against "Jews" doing ANYthing, just an 
observation.
